page.title: 08Events: the Guildford Paper
page.content: Items from the local paper - July l985 (1) Despite popularity with local people, Guildford Borough Council has forced a neighbourhood{supermarket}to close on Sundays. As landlord, the Council is enforcing the Shops Act. (2) Mrs. Susan Boxall won Â£100 first prize in the paper's weekly Supa-Scratch Match{Game.}The numbers on her game card matched with those published this week. A family holiday at Butlin's Holiday Camp, Bognor Regis is planned. (3) Woodbridge Road Sports Ground is to be the venue for a{brass band concert, hosted by the Mayor. Two local bands, The Phoenix Youth Band and the First Stoughton Scout and Guide Band, will take part, together with the Freiberg First Trumpet Orchestra. The West German town is twinned with Guildford.
